Maladies Treated: Seeds: wind-heat type of cold or influenza
Seeds: swelling and pain of the throat
Seeds: acute or chronic inflammation of the throat
Medical Function: Seeds: disperses wind-heat, vents rashes and benefits the throat, resolves toxins and disperses swelling
Roots: disperses wind-heat and reduces swelling
Antibiotic: decoction had significant antibacterial action on Streptococcus pneumoniae; aqueous infusion inhibited multiple pathogenic skin fungi to varying degrees
Lowers blood sugar: extract lowered blood glucose of albino rats; high tolerance to carbohydrates; low toxicity
Anti-tumor: crude extract shows selective toxicity; relatively low amounts inhibit cancer cell proliferation and make tumor cells approach normal cells
Samples of Formulae:
ESSIAC Formula (a North American folk formula for cancer therapy): Composition: Burdock root (Arctium lappa root) 67.7%, Sheep sorrel herb (Rumex acetosella) 21.6%, Turkish rhubarb root (da huang [Rheum palmatum]) 5.0%, Slippery elm inner bark 5.0%.

Yin Qiao San (Honeysuckle and Forsythia Powder): Application: wind-heat influenza with swollen and painful throat. Composition: Niu Bang Zi (burdock fruit), Lian Qiao (forsythia fruit), Jin Yin Hua (honeysuckle flower), Jing Jie (schizonepeta), Jie Geng (platycodon), etc.

Niu Bang Tang (Burdock Seed Decoction): Application: wind-heat congestion with severe throat pain (風熱壅盛，咽喉腫痛). Composition: Niu Bang Zi (burdock fruit), Da Huang (rhubarb), Bo He (field mint), Fang Feng (saposhnikovia).

For wind-heat cough with profuse, not easily expectorated phlegm (風熱咳嗽，痰多不暢): Composition: Niu Bang Zi (burdock fruit), Jing Jie (schizonepeta), Jie Geng (platycodon), Qian Hu (peucedanum), Gan Cao (licorice).

Tou Zhen Tang (Venting the Rash Decoction): Application: measles not fully erupting or erupting and then hiding (麻疹不透或透而復隱). Composition: Niu Bang Zi (burdock fruit), Bo He (field mint), Jing Jie (schizonepeta), Chan Tui (cicada slough), Zi Cao (lithospermum).

For swellings, sores, mumps, throat impediment with concurrent constipation (癰腫瘡毒，腮腺炎〔痄腮〕喉痺，兼有便秘者): Composition: Niu Bang Zi (burdock fruit), Da Huang (rhubarb), Mang Xiao (mirabilite), Zhi Zi (gardenia), Lian Qiao (forsythia), Bo He (field mint), etc.

Gua Wei Niu Bang Tang (Trichosanthes and Burdock Decoction): Application: breast abscess due to liver constraint transforming into fire and stomach heat obstructing the networks (肝郁化火，胃熱壅絡之乳癰症). Composition: Niu Bang Zi (burdock fruit), Gua Lou / Gua Wei (trichosanthes fruit), Lian Qiao (forsythia), Tian Hua Fen (trichosanthes root), Qing Pi (green tangerine peel).

Pu Ji Xiao Du Yin (Universal Benefit Detoxifying Drink): Application: epidemic parotitis (mumps), erysipelas, acute tonsillitis, suppurative parotitis, lymphadenitis. Source: Li Dongyuan, Yi Fang Ji Jie (李東垣《醫方集解》). Composition and doses: Huang Qin (scutellaria) 15 g, Huang Lian (coptis) 15 g, Niu Bang Zi (burdock fruit) 10 g, Lian Qiao (forsythia) 10 g, Bo He (field mint) 10 g, Bai Jiang Can (stiff silkworm) 10 g, Xuan Shen (scrophularia) 10 g, Ban Lan Gen (isatis root) 10 g, Jie Geng (platycodon) 10 g, Chen Pi (aged tangerine peel) 6 g, Ma Bo (puffball) 6 g, Sheng Ma (cimicifuga) 6 g, Chai Hu (bupleurum) 6 g, Gan Cao (licorice) 6 g. Decoction for oral use.
[Modifications]
(a) If exterior evil is obvious and internal heat is mild: reduce Huang Qin to 6 g, Huang Lian to 6 g; add Jing Jie (schizonepeta) 10 g, Fang Feng (saposhnikovia) 9 g.
(b) If the exterior has been resolved but internal heat remains intense: remove Sheng Ma (cimicifuga), Chai Hu (bupleurum).
(c) If there is concurrent constipation: add Da Huang (rhubarb) 10 g.
Contraindications: Do not use for chicken pox or smallpox. Avoid in qixu with loose stool. Because it is cold in nature and slippery, avoid in vacuity cold patterns and in pox disorders; contraindicated for patients with qi deficiency and loose stools.
Research:
Antibiotic action: Fructus Arctii decoction had significant antibacterial action against Streptococcus pneumoniae; a water infusion inhibited multiple pathogenic skin fungi to varying degrees.

Blood sugar-lowering action: Fructus Arctii extract lowered blood glucose in albino rats; has high tolerance to carbohydrates and low toxicity.

Antipyretic action.

Diuretic action.

Anti-tumor action: The crude extract exhibits selective toxicity; at relatively low amounts it can inhibit cancer cell proliferation and make tumor cells approach normal cells; it may become a powerful anticancer herbal medicine.

Toxicity: Fructus Arctii can cause tonic convulsions in frogs, mice, and rabbits, with respiration becoming weak, disappearance of voluntary movement, and finally entry into a paralyzed state.

According to the Zhongyi Da Baike Quanshu (中醫大百科全書): Treatment of seasonal epidemic cold (時行感冒) takes relieving the exterior and dispersing evil as the principle, sometimes combined with clearing heat and resolving toxin, eliminating summerheat and dispelling dampness; specific medications should be adjusted based on pattern differentiation. Patterns include:
1) Wind-cold binding the exterior, evil depressing the defensive aspect (風寒束表，邪鬱衛分): signs include fever with pronounced aversion to cold, absence of sweating, headache, body aches, clear nasal discharge, frequent sneezing, slight cough without phlegm, thin white tongue coat, floating tight pulse. Treatment: acrid-warm to relieve the exterior; commonly use Jing Fang Bai Du San (荊防敗毒散) with modifications.
2) Wind-heat invading the Lung, evil in the defensive aspect (風熱犯肺，邪在衛分): signs include relatively high fever, slight aversion to cold, little sweating, headache, cough with scant sticky phlegm, or swollen painful throat, dry mouth with desire to drink, red tongue, thin yellow coat, floating rapid pulse. Treatment: acrid-cool to relieve the exterior; commonly use Yin Qiao San (銀翹散) with modifications.
3) Summerheat-damp on the exterior (暑濕在表): signs include fever, aversion to cold, absence of sweating or slight sweating, headache, limb fatigue or soreness, vexation and thirst, chest oppression and epigastric stuffiness, nausea, yellow urine or diarrhea, tongue coat thin yellow and greasy, pulse soft rapid. Treatment: clear summerheat, transform dampness, and relieve the exterior; commonly use Xin Jia Xiang Ru Yin (新加香薷飲) with modifications.
